com.test9.irc.display

Class ChatWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.test9.irc.display.ChatWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.WindowFocusListener, java.awt.event.WindowStateListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class ChatWindow
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.WindowStateListener, java.awt.event.WindowFocusListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener

        private static final int DEFAULTSIDEBARWIDTH
        The default width of the side panel that will hold the user list and the connection tree.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • defaultWindowSize

        private static java.awt.Dimension defaultWindowSize
        Default window size of the JFrame calculated from the KIT. Makes the window half the side of the screen.

      • connectionTree

        private ConnectionTree connectionTree
        Holds all the channel and server connections used in the JTree.

      • inputField

        private final javax.swing.JTextField inputField
        Input field to allow the user to input strings and send them to IRCConnection send().

      • centerJPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel centerJPanel
        Holds the center JLayered pane that will hold all of the output panels.

      • treePanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel treePanel
        Holds the tree that will list all server and channel connections.

      • sidePanelSplitPane

        private javax.swing.JSplitPane sidePanelSplitPane
        Splits the connection tree up from the user list. User list on top and the connection tree on the bottom.

      • listsAndOutputSplitPane

        private javax.swing.JSplitPane listsAndOutputSplitPane
        Splits the sidePanelSplitPane from the output panels and the input panel. Output/Input on the left, side bar on the east side.

      • userListsLayeredPane

        private final javax.swing.JLayeredPane userListsLayeredPane
        Holds the user lists for each channel.

      • outputFieldLayeredPane

        private final javax.swing.JLayeredPane outputFieldLayeredPane
        Holds the output panels for each channel and server connection.

      • outputPanels

        private java.util.ArrayList<OutputPanel> outputPanels
        Holds references to all of the output panels for the connected servers and channels.

      • userListPanels

        private java.util.ArrayList<UserListPanel> userListPanels
        Holds references to all of the user lists for all of the connected channels.

      • activeServer

        private java.lang.String activeServer
        Holds the name of the currectly active server. This is set by selecting a server or channel node on the connectionTree.

      • activeChannel

        private java.lang.String activeChannel
        Holds the name of the currectly active server. This is set by selecting a channel node on the connectionTree.

      • treeScrollPane

        private javax.swing.JScrollPane treeScrollPane
        A scroll pane to contain the connection tree.

      • menuBar

        private MenuBar menuBar
        Holds the main menubar for the client.

      • joinedAServer

        private boolean joinedAServer
        Checks to see if a server has been joined.

      • ircConnections

        private java.util.ArrayList<IRCConnection> ircConnections
        Holds references to each of the ircConnections. Is used when the user wishes to send a message to a giver server or channel.

      • oF

        private OutputFactory oF
        Used to properly format a message that is sent to an IRCConnection.

      • titles

        private java.util.ArrayList<Title> titles
        Holds the possible titles that can be used on the frame.

        private Listener listener

      • util

      • loadColors

      • addChatWindowListener

        public void addChatWindowListener(Listener listener)

      • joinChannel

        void joinChannel(java.lang.String server)
        Constructs a channel for a server connection. Does not join any channels on the server. This is only called by joinServer() locally in the class.
        Parameters:
        server - Name of the server to join.

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Used to send a message to a particular channel or server when the user hits VK_ENTER in the inputfield. Sends the message to the active channel and active server after it sends it to the output factory for formatting.
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • newOutputPanel

        void newOutputPanel(java.lang.String server,
                  java.lang.String channel)
        Creates a new output panel for a server or channel. Server and Channel name is the same if this is an output panel for a server.
        Parameters:
        server - Name of the server.
        channel - Name of the channel.

      • newActiveChannels

        void newActiveChannels(java.lang.String activeServer,
                     java.lang.String activeChannel)
        Called by the ConnectionTree class when a new node on the tree is selected. Brings the appropriate output field and user lists to the front of their JLayeredPanes.
        Parameters:
        activeServer - The name of the server that the user has selected in the connectionTree.
        activeChannel - The name of the channel that the user has selected in the connection tree.
